fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: Directive 1025/2012, Privacy Shield, Digital Single Market initiative, European Accessibility Act. GDPR, Eprivacy, Platforms, Data flows,
organisation_name: ITI - The Information Technology Industry Council (ITI)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication: ITI's interaction with the Commission is primarily through direct contacts, e.g., in-office meetings, symposiums and workshops, and via collaboration with other industry associations, such as DIGITALEUROPE, BUSINESSEUROPE, Allied for Startups, and others.  We also submit comments in response to public consultations on matters of interest to our membership.
goals__remit:
The Information Technology Industry Council (ITI) is the premier ICT advocacy and policy organization for the world’s leading innovation companies.  We have earned the trust of the world’s most recognized technology brands to solve their most complex policy challenges around the globe. 
 
Based in Washington, DC, USA, ITI attracts members companies from Europe, Asia and North America that pioneer cutting-edge products and services that improve people’s daily lives.  We collaborate with governments, industry, academia and civil society to develop and implement policies that promote economic expansion, job creation and unfettered access to the Internet and all it entails. 
We opened the ITI Europe office in Brussels in October 2017
